title: I love seeing how the changes in lore and the world effect this board
body:
I personally love seeing how everytime there's a lore change, new champion or a rework and maybe even some more worldbuilding, like the recent map, we lore geeks just crawl out of caves and shout "OMG THERE'S AN UPDATE IT'S MY TIME TO SHINE" and get really excited and dive right into the update, think about some theories for the future and finally relax about 5 days later only to crawl back to our caves, waiting for the next update while making up some more theories.
I don't know why, but I find it quite satisfying. Anyone else agree?

Are you REALLY just doing it because we care about it, or maybe, just a small possibility, hear me out here, a GAME STUDIO has some interest in flashing out their IP for future products? I mean an aweful lot of people worked hard on all that art, all these people would need to be paid, it would be silly not to assume that this was not done with some plan to make this profitable in the future. 

Actually, you're the best person to ask, Mr. BRAND MANAGER. So what are the planes of the Runeterra IP for the future? I'm sure you can tell us a little of it...

Of course having a strong IP is important for the future of the company. But if no one cared and no one really asked for any of this, we wouldn't dedicate resources into it.

Think about esports. Today it makes total sense to have it, but back when we started our exploration into esports it wasn't so obvious and it actually **didn't** make financial sense to invest in it. We just did it because we liked it as players and we knew there was potential to keep our players happy and engaged. Lore and IP development is the same. Games don't **need** a strong IP to be successful, but because our players (including a lot of Rioters) are so passionate about it, we developed more and more always growing as the demand for it also grew.

So, all in all, Riot is and has always been (I've been here for 6 years now lol) a player-centric company, so if we find that what we do resonates with players we grow support for it.
